PUBLICATIONS AND LAW CASES (Boxes 110-119)(See boxes 118 and 119 for works by Bell)
Derrick Bell Published articles in Journals 1956-1993 (bound and un-bound)

-Loyola University of Chicago Law Journal, Vol 8, No 4, Summer 1977, "Fair Employment Practices Symposium" -Southern University Law Review, Vol. 4, No. 1, Fall 1977, "Graglia: Disaster by Decree" - "The Legacy of W.E.B. Du Bois: A Rational Model for Achieving Public School Equity for America's Black Children," from Creighton Law Review, Dec 1977 -Freedomways, Vol. 17, No. 1, 1977 "School Desegregation" -Business and Society Review, No. 22 Summer 1977, "A Civil Rights Suit Against A Law First" -Theory Into Practice, Vol 17, No 1, Feb 1978 -Theory Into Practice, Vol 17, No 2, April 1978, "The Community Role in the Education of Poor, Black Children" -Juris Doctor, April 1978, "Inside Chicago: Conformity and Social Change" -First World, Vol 2, No 1, Spring 1978"The Curse of Brown on Black" -Clearinghouse for Civil Rights Research, Vol 6, No 1-2, Autumn-Winter 1978 -Washington Law Review, "Lecture Series, The Referendum: Democracy's Barrier to Racial Equality" -The Journal of Negro History, Vol 63, No. 3, July 1978 -Phi Kappa Phi Journal, Winter 1978, "The High Price of Non-Representation."
